page.title: 04Farming at Upper Bentley
page.content: {Daily Work}varies but always includes milking twice.In winter livestock must be fed twice. Cattle sheds have to be cleaned out, the waste lagoon has slurry. Machinery has to be maintained during poor weather by family or those in{employment}there.In summer cereals} are grown, their quality and quantity improved by fertilizing, pesticides, and weedkillers. Grass is cut for {silage,}the frequency depending on rainfall. It is put in a pit, pressed down and covered with black plastic to make it air tight. If potatoes are plentiful they are added.Some grass is left for hay,then dried and baled. In August cereals are{harvested,}some are sold and some stored.Then the straw is stored for bedding. Also during summer slurry is retrieved from the lagoon and sprayed on the pasture. It is then ploughed ready for next year.
